intro: Lomandra banksii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lomandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces spikes of yellow flowers in late summer. It is drought-tolerant and well adapted to coastal environments. Lomandra banksii is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
